API Documentation

Complete guide to using our REST API for student data access

API Overview

Base URL

https://your-domain.com/api/v1

Authentication

All API requests require authentication using an API key.

X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Rate Limiting

API requests are limited to 1000 requests per hour per user.

üîí Data Access Workflow

‚ö†Ô∏è Security Notice

Student data is protected by a request-approval system. You cannot access detailed student information without explicit approval from the student.

1

Browse Available Students

Use GET /api/v1/students to see all available students with basic information only.

Available data: Name, email, student ID, department, major, year

2

Submit Access Request

Use POST /api/v1/access-requests to request specific data from a student.

Required: student_id, requested_data, purpose

3

Wait for Approval

The student will review your request and decide whether to approve or reject it.

Use GET /api/v1/access-requests to check the status of your requests.

4

Access Approved Data

Once approved, use GET /api/v1/approved-data/{student_id} to access the detailed information you requested.

Note: You can only access data that was specifically approved in your request.

Authentication

Authentication Flow

To use the API, you need to authenticate first and then generate an API key:

Step 1: Login

Authenticate with your email and password to get a temporary token:

POST /api/v1/auth/login
Headers: Content-Type: application/json
Body: {"email": "your_email", "password": "your_password"}
Response:
{
  "success": true,
  "token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9...",
  "user": {...},
  "message": "Authentication successful"
}

Step 2: Generate API Key

Use the token to generate your permanent API key:

POST /api/v1/generate-api-key
Headers: Authorization: Bearer your_token_here
Body: {} (empty JSON object)
Response:
{
  "success": true,
  "api_key": "abc123def456...",
  "message": "API key generated successfully"
}

Step 3: Use API Key

Include your API key in all subsequent requests:

X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

API Endpoints

Get All Students

Retrieve a list of all students with basic information.

GET /api/v1/students
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "students": [
    {
      "user_id": 1,
      "full_name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "student_id": "STU001",
      "department": "Computer Science",
      "major": "Software Engineering",
      "year": "Senior"
    }
  ],
  "count": 1
}

Get Student Details

Get basic information about a specific student. Note: Detailed information requires an approved access request.

GET /api/v1/students/{student_id}
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "student": {
    "user_id": 1,
    "full_name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "student_id": "STU001",
    "department": "Computer Science",
    "major": "Software Engineering",
    "year": "Senior"
  },
  "has_approved_access": false,
  "message": "You need to submit an access request to view detailed information. Use /api/v1/access-requests (POST) to request access."
}

‚ö†Ô∏è Important Security Note:

This endpoint only returns basic student information. To access detailed personal, academic, or contact information, you must:

  1. Submit an access request using POST /api/v1/access-requests
  2. Wait for the student to approve your request
  3. Use GET /api/v1/approved-data/{student_id} to access detailed information

Submit Access Request

Submit a request to access student data.

POST /api/v1/access-requests
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body:

{
  "student_id": 1,
  "requested_data": "academic_records,contact_info",
  "purpose": "Research study on student demographics"
}

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "request_id": 123,
  "message": "Access request submitted successfully"
}

Get Access Requests

Retrieve all your access requests with optional filtering.

GET /api/v1/access-requests?status=pending&limit=10&offset=0
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Query Parameters:

  • status: pending, approved, rejected (optional)
  • limit: number of results (default: 50)
  • offset: pagination offset (default: 0)

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "requests": [
    {
      "request_id": 123,
      "student_id": 1,
      "requested_data": "academic_records",
      "purpose": "Research study",
      "status": "pending",
      "request_date": "2024-01-15T10:30:00",
      "response_date": null,
      "student_name": "John Doe",
      "student_email": "john@example.com"
    }
  ],
  "total": 1,
  "limit": 10,
  "offset": 0
}

Get Access Request Details

Get detailed information about a specific access request.

GET /api/v1/access-requests/{request_id}
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "request": {
    "request_id": 123,
    "student_id": 1,
    "requested_data": "academic_records",
    "purpose": "Research study",
    "status": "approved",
    "request_date": "2024-01-15T10:30:00",
    "response_date": "2024-01-16T14:20:00",
    "response_message": "Request approved for research purposes",
    "student_name": "John Doe",
    "student_email": "john@example.com"
  }
}

Get Approved Student Data

Access approved student data (only works if you have approved requests for this student).

GET /api/v1/approved-data/{student_id}
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "student_data": {
    "user_id": 1,
    "full_name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "student_id": "STU001",
    "department": "Computer Science",
    "phone": "+1234567890",
    "birth_date": "2000-01-01",
    "gender": "Male",
    "major": "Software Engineering",
    "year": "Senior",
    "gpa": "3.8",
    "advisor": "Dr. Smith",
    "linkedin_url": "https://linkedin.com/in/johndoe",
    "github_url": "https://github.com/johndoe",
    "address": "123 Main St",
    "city": "New York",
    "state": "NY",
    "contact_phone": "+1234567890"
  },
  "approved_requests": 2
}

Get Statistics

Get your request statistics and activity metrics.

GET /api/v1/stats
Headers: X-API-Key: your_api_key_here

Response:

{
  "success": true,
  "stats": {
    "total_requests": 25,
    "pending_requests": 3,
    "approved_requests": 18,
    "rejected_requests": 4,
    "recent_requests_30_days": 8
  }
}

Error Responses

401 Unauthorized

{
  "error": "API key required"
}

403 Forbidden

{
  "error": "No approved requests found for this student"
}

404 Not Found

{
  "error": "Student not found"
}

400 Bad Request

{
  "error": "Missing required field: student_id"
}

Code Examples

Python Example

import requests

BASE_URL = "https://your-domain.com/api/v1"
EMAIL = "your_email@example.com"
PASSWORD = "your_password"

# Step 1: Login to get token
login_response = requests.post(
    f"{BASE_URL}/auth/login",
    headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"},
    json={"email": EMAIL, "password": PASSWORD}
)
login_data = login_response.json()
token = login_data["token"]

# Step 2: Generate API key
api_key_response = requests.post(
    f"{BASE_URL}/generate-api-key",
    headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"}
)
api_key_data = api_key_response.json()
API_KEY = api_key_data["api_key"]

# Step 3: Use API key for requests
# Get all students (basic info only)
response = requests.get(
    f"{BASE_URL}/students",
    headers={"X-API-Key": API_KEY}
)
students = response.json()

# Submit access request for detailed data
request_data = {
    "student_id": 1,
    "requested_data": "academic_records,contact_info",
    "purpose": "Research study"
}

response = requests.post(
    f"{BASE_URL}/access-requests",
    headers={
        "X-API-Key": API_KEY,
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    },
    json=request_data
)
result = response.json()

# Check request status
response = requests.get(
    f"{BASE_URL}/access-requests",
    headers={"X-API-Key": API_KEY}
)
requests = response.json()

# Once approved, access detailed data
response = requests.get(
    f"{BASE_URL}/approved-data/1",
    headers={"X-API-Key": API_KEY}
)
detailed_data = response.json()

JavaScript Example

const BASE_URL = "https://your-domain.com/api/v1";
const EMAIL = "your_email@example.com";
const PASSWORD = "your_password";

// Step 1: Login to get token
fetch(`${BASE_URL}/auth/login`, {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    email: EMAIL,
    password: PASSWORD
  })
})
.then(response => response.json())
.then(data => {
  const token = data.token;
  
  // Step 2: Generate API key
  return fetch(`${BASE_URL}/generate-api-key`, {
    method: "POST",
    headers: {
      "Authorization": `Bearer ${token}`
    }
  });
})
.then(response => response.json())
.then(data => {
  const API_KEY = data.api_key;
  
  // Step 3: Use API key for requests
  // Get all students (basic info only)
  fetch(`${BASE_URL}/students`, {
    headers: {
      "X-API-Key": API_KEY
    }
  })
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));
  
  // Submit access request for detailed data
  const requestData = {
    student_id: 1,
    requested_data: "academic_records,contact_info",
    purpose: "Research study"
  };
  
  fetch(`${BASE_URL}/access-requests`, {
    method: "POST",
    headers: {
      "X-API-Key": API_KEY,
      "Content-Type": "application/json"
    },
    body: JSON.stringify(requestData)
  })
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));
  
  // Check request status
  fetch(`${BASE_URL}/access-requests`, {
    headers: {
      "X-API-Key": API_KEY
    }
  })
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));
  
  // Once approved, access detailed data
  fetch(`${BASE_URL}/approved-data/1`, {
    headers: {
      "X-API-Key": API_KEY
    }
  })
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));
});
